body_html:
@lukeyeager The most straightforward way to make a tensorflow deb package is to repack the official whl package as a deb package, in which the Bazel dependency is skipped.

Tensorflow packaging is in my todolist but with a low priority, since pip / conda already provided a quite convenient way to install. Currently some Debian developer is also interested in packaging tensorflow, and he is currently trying to solve the Bazel ITP.

body:
@lukeyeager The most straightforward way to make a tensorflow deb package is to repack the official whl package as a deb package, in which the Bazel dependency is skipped.

Tensorflow packaging is in my todolist but with a low priority, since pip / conda already provided a quite convenient way to install. Currently some Debian developer is also interested in packaging tensorflow, and he is currently trying to solve the Bazel ITP.
